member.name: T:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm
member.summary: This Windows Form is used to display error messages and, optionally, the detailed diagnostic information provided when an exception is caught

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.#ctor
member.summary: Contructs a form to display an error message

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.DisplayError(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use this method to display non-fatal error messages. This method must be used to insure consistency between all data views and to provide as much visibility as possible to all error information.
member.param: This is the primary message that will be displayed to the user
This is the exception object that originally caused the error. It is important to provide this information to the user when available to assist in debugging and error resolution
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 09/13/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.DisplayWarning(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use this method to display warning messages.
member.param: This is the primary message that will be displayed to the user
This is the exception object that originally caused the warning.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.Message
member.summary: This property sets the error message displayed to the user. This message should be easily understood and instructive to the user but not filled with debugging details

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.OriginatingException
member.summary: This property exposes the member data of the exception that caused the offending error.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.ErrorForm.IconSelection
member.summary: This property sets the error image on the form. Note that only a warning icon and error icon are supported

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView
member.summary: Base class for all of the views possible in data manager. This class provides common functions for all derived views such as managing screen refreshing, handling progress indicators, error handling and data item selection.

member.summary: This event is fired by a data view whenever the user checks or removes a selection from the data view

member.summary: This event is fired whenever a progress bar should be displayed

member.summary: This event is fired to indicate that the progress bar should be removed and normal processing can resume

member.name: E:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.StepProgressEvent
member.summary: This event is fired to more the progress indictor a single step forward

member.summary: Primary constructor. This constructor MUST be called by all derived classes

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects (sets the check box) all data items currently shown in the data grid

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears all data item selections from the data grid.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.InitializeAutoRefresh(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This method is by derived classes to indicate which directory or file the current view is representing and to begin watching that file or directory for changes so that the view can be refreshed when needed.
Note that this method can be overrided as needed to set different filters on the file or directory to be watched. By default the watcher will only fire events when the last write time of the file or directory changes.
member.param: This is the path of the directory watch for changes
This is the name of the specific file or file mask to watch for changes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.ResetAutoRefresh(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is by derived classes to change which directory or file the current view is watching changes so that the view can be refreshed when needed.
member.param: This is the path of the directory watch for changes
This is the name of the specific file or file mask to watch for changes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/26/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.EnableAutoRefresh
member.summary: This method enables the update notifications and automatic refreshing of the data view when the root directory or file changes. Note that this method is called as a part of the InitializeAutoRefresh method so it is only needed to re-enable update notifications after they have been disabled.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.DisableAutoRefresh
member.summary: This method disables the update notifications and automatic refreshing of the data view when the root directory or file changes.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.OnViewDataRenamed(System.Object,System.IO.RenamedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever a renamed event is raised. By default, the data view is refreshed but this method can be overriden to perform custom actions as needed by derived classes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.OnViewDataChanged(System.Object,System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever a data changed event is raised. By default, the data view is refreshed but this method can be overriden to perform custom actions as needed by derived classes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.OnViewDataDeleted(System.Object,System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever a data changed event is raised. By default, the data view is refreshed but this method can be overriden to perform custom actions as needed by derived classes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.OnViewDataCreated(System.Object,System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever a data changed event is raised. By default, the data view is refreshed but this method can be overriden to perform custom actions as needed by derived classes
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.RefreshDataViewItem(System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the current data view asynchronously. This method can be overrided by derived classes to perform custom actions on refresh operations but care must be taken to ensure thread safety since this method is typically invoked by a thread that does not own the UI controls. Note that the default implementation completely reinitializes the data view. Therefore user selections are cleared.
member.param: The full path name of the item that was updated. This information is provided so that derived classes can decide if the entire view must be refreshed or only a single item
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.RenameDataViewItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the current data view asynchronously to reflect the fact that an item was renamed. This method should be overriden by derived classes to perform custom actions on refresh operations but care must be taken to ensure thread safety since this method is typically invoked by a thread that does not own the UI controls. Note that there is no default implementation. Therefore any view that needs to react to the renaming of a data file must implement this method
member.param: The original full path name of the file that was renamed. This information is provided so that derived classes can decide if the entire view must be refreshed or only a single item
The new full path name of the file that was renamed.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 11/20/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.DeleteDataViewItem(System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the current data view asynchronously to reflect the fact that an item was deleted. This method should be overriden by derived classes to perform custom actions on refresh operations but care must be taken to ensure thread safety since this method is typically invoked by a thread that does not own the UI controls. Note that there is no default implementation. Therefore any view that needs to react to the deletion of a data file must implement this method
member.param: The full path name of the file that was deleted. This information is provided so that derived classes can decide if the entire view must be refreshed or only a single item
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/26/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.CreateDataViewItem(System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the current data view asynchronously to reflect the addition of a new data item. This method can be overrided by derived classes to perform custom actions on refresh operations but care must be taken to ensure thread safety since this method is typically invoked by a thread that does not own the UI controls. Note that there is no default implementation.
member.param: The full path name of the item that was added. This information is provided so that derived classes can decide if the entire view must be refreshed or only a single item
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.PopulateDataView
member.summary: This method must be overriden by derived classes to populate the data view.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 07/19/07 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.FlexGridView.DisplayError(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use this method to display non-fatal error messages. This method must be used to insure consistency between all data views and to provide as much visibility as possible to all error information.
member.param: This is the primary message that will be displayed to the user
This is the exception object that originally caused the error. It is important to provide this information to the user when available to assist in debugging and error resolution

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.MessageForm
member.summary: This class provides a simple, consistent mechanism for displaying a message to the user in a modal dialog box. It is similar to the System.Forms.MessageBox class but the form properties are more consistent with the current Itron/DataManager form styles. The message form should only be accessed via the static ShowMessage method.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.MessageForm.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for the message form. Note that it is protected and cannot be called directly from a client application. Instead the 'ShowMessage' method should be used to create and display the message form.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------------- ----------------------------------- 08/27/08 MAH 9.50 Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.MessageForm.MessageText
member.summary: This property sets the primary text displayed on the message form
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------------- ----------------------------------- 08/27/08 MAH 9.50 Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.SharedControls.MessageForm.ShowMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This is the primary method to be used when displaying an interactive text message to the user. This method should be used instead of the standard System.Forms.MessageBox class in order to provide a more consistent user interface to the operator
member.param: The text of the form's title. Typically this is the application and/or function name
The text of the message to be displayed
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------------- ----------------------------------- 08/27/08 MAH 9.50 Created
